content.description:
Stand start just right of the arete with your left hand on a sharp flake and your right hand in the left-trending crack. Move up, and top out. 

  This is like starting in the middle of Prophecy.
content.location:
This is on the same boulder as Prophecy, just to its right. 

  From the trail, instead of cutting right into the Remnants area, continue until the trail splits, and go right by the boulder with Arrested Development on it. About 100 feet down the trail you'll see the backside of this boulder (the slab with Sauce Toe  on it) off to the right ~50 feet.

content.description: This problem has had a convoluted history. The original posted problem was a really low sit start on the steep arête/face.The problem began with an extremely low left hand side pull out on the left face and a slightly higher right hand tiny crimp on the arête. Move up and match on the crimpy feature on the arête. Then move up and top out. Look at the first posted photo from Blake D. to see the original start holds. That beta is solid V5-6. Starting higher eases the grade but still a cool problem.
content.location: This is at the far left end of the Remnants area.

content.description:
Stand up on a little ridge by the ground to start, and work your way left and up tiny footholds and crimps on the slab. Everything is cleaned that needs to be for the send. 

  With the potential cheese-grater down if you fell towards to top, it's a bit heady - but fun if you like slab.
content.protection: It is not a bad landing, a pad and an attentive spotter would be sufficient.
content.location:
This is on the other side of the boulder from Prophecy, left of Carl's Gnarl. 

  From the trail, instead of cutting right into the Remnants area, continue until the trail splits, and go right by the boulder with Arrested Development on it. About 100 feet down the trail you'll see the slab with Sauce Toe on it off to the right ~50 feet.

content.description: Do the same start as Hubris, but after the first move, go straight up with a big move to a crappy sloper and some funk to stand up....
Squat start on far right arete matched on an undercling, make a hard move to the slopers on arete, and traverse left to join the topout of Prophecy... a gem IMO.
content.location: Start 20 feet right of Prophecy on the other side of the split landing where the trail comes up to the bloc.

content.description: Start on the far right (a few feet right of Sauce Toe) of the slab, and traverse the lip to exit above The Foretelling.
content.location: Traverse the low side of the boulder.

content.description: Start with low hands on the slopes left leaning seem. low feet. and go straight up.
content.location: On the short side of the boulder about 8' left of prophesy

content.description: Stand up on the little knob, and hope your feet stick as you move up and left.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter, because the landing is a somewhat steep slope.
content.location: It is a few feet right of Sauce Toe.

content.description: This is a cool block with good rock.
